pipeline¶

pipeline of analysis

Functions

diff(im, tdiff, tsmooth)

normalize im between 0 and 1; smoothe in xy using guidedFilter; temporal difference; smoothe in z using savgol_filter

excitation(mask[, gaptmin])

remove short(in time) and small(in area) excitations find pixels that enter from non-excited to excited state

kinetics(points, imstack, T[, radius])

measure mean intensity in circles as a functin of time

movavg_bc(path[, channel, dt, gauss])

calculate moving average in z; correct for photobleach

periodicity(newexc, FMAX, TMAX[, DT])

use imagestack of new excitation to calculate temporal frequency and wait time distribution between consecutative excitations

run(temp)

save_rois(path, graph, cntdict)

pipeline.movavg_bc(path, channel='G', dt=1.2, gauss=None)[source]¶

calculate moving average in z; correct for photobleach

pipeline.diff(im, tdiff, tsmooth)[source]¶

normalize im between 0 and 1; smoothe in xy using guidedFilter; temporal difference; smoothe in z using savgol_filter

Parameters

tdiff,tsmooth – time window in seconds for difference and smooth in time

pipeline.excitation(mask, gaptmin=[6, 3])[source]¶

remove short(in time) and small(in area) excitations find pixels that enter from non-excited to excited state

Parameters

mask (np.array((Z,X,Y),bool)) – binary mask where diff is larger than threshold

Returns

binary array of excitations and new_excitations. both of type np.array((Z,X,Y),bool)

pipeline.periodicity(newexc, FMAX, TMAX, DT=2.4)[source]¶

use imagestack of new excitation to calculate temporal frequency and wait time distribution between consecutative excitations

Parameters

  • newexc (np.array((Z,X,Y),bool)) – imagestack

  • FMAX – max value for frequency

  • TMAX – max value for wait time

Returns

newexcsum,(frequency_t,frequency_y),(wait_t,wait_y)

pipeline.kinetics(points, imstack, T, radius=7)[source]¶

measure mean intensity in circles as a functin of time

Returns

np.array((Ncircles, time, channel))
